description: Cancer progression modeling involves understanding how cancer develops and progresses over time. This can help in developing targeted therapies and understanding the underlying mechanisms of tumor growth.
you_have_this_if: You are studying the mechanisms of cancer development.
You need to evaluate the effectiveness of new cancer therapies.
You are investigating the relationship between cancer and other diseases.
You require a model to simulate tumor growth and progression.
You are focused on specific proteins or genetic factors influencing cancer.

approaches.best_for: Developing therapies targeting DNA damage response in melanoma and studying specific proteins in tumor growth.
approaches.key_tradeoff: This approach provides a controlled experimental model but may not fully replicate human cancer complexity.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a reliable model to study specific genetic factors in cancer progression.

start_here: The TG3 Snca knockout mouse model is recommended as the first approach for studying cancer progression due to its ability to simulate specific genetic alterations relevant to tumor growth.
